question: [File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: new()] [State inconsistency] Can an attacker exploit the scenario where table_info_reader and db_indexer_reader are at different ledger versions during construction, causing queries to return inconsistent state data that violates Merkle tree integrity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: new()] [Availability bypass] Can a malicious node deliberately pass None for both readers to cause IndexerReaders::new() to return None, making the system fall back to less secure or unindexed query paths that bypass access controls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: new()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to new() with the same Arc<IndexerAsyncV2> or Arc<DBIndexer> instances create race conditions where one reader gets updated while another is being cloned, leading to inconsistent query results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: new()] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker repeatedly call new() with valid readers to create unbounded IndexerReaders instances, exhausting memory through Arc reference counting without proper cleanup? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: is_internal_indexer_enabled()] [Logic bypass] Can an attacker manipulate the DBIndexer instance state to make is_internal_indexer_enabled() return false when it should return true, causing the API to incorrectly route queries to unindexed paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Availability check bypass] If db_indexer_reader.indexer_db.event_enabled() returns false, does the error path leak any sensitive information about the indexer state or configuration that could be exploited? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [TOCTOU race] Between checking event_enabled() at line 77 and calling get_events() at line 78-84, can the indexer be disabled by another thread, causing undefined behavior or data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events_by_event_key()] [Inconsistent checks] Does get_events_by_event_key() perform the same security validations as get_events(), or can it be used to bypass event_enabled() checks through a different code path? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_account_ordered_transactions()] [Feature flag bypass] Can an attacker craft requests that bypass the transaction_enabled() check at line 125, accessing transaction data even when the indexer feature is disabled? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_prefixed_state_value_iterator()] [Statekeys check bypass] If statekeys_enabled() is checked at line 147 but the feature is disabled mid-iteration, can this cause the iterator to return corrupted or unauthorized state data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_translated_v1_event_by_version_and_index()] [Translation bypass] Can event_v2_translation_enabled() be bypassed to access untranslated or malformed event data that violates type safety assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_table_info()] [Handle validation] Does get_table_info() validate that the TableHandle parameter is legitimate, or can an attacker provide crafted handles to access arbitrary memory locations or system tables? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_table_info()] [Version inconsistency] Can get_table_info() return table metadata from a different ledger version than expected, causing transactions to operate on stale or inconsistent table state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_table_info()] [Error handling leak] When table_info_reader is None and the function bails at line 51, does the error message leak information about which indexer components are enabled/disabled? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_table_info()] [Retry attack] Can an attacker exploit the get_table_info_with_retry() mechanism to cause excessive database queries, leading to resource exhaustion or slowdowns affecting consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_table_info()] [Race condition] Between checking table_info_reader.is_some() and calling get_table_info_with_retry(), can the reader be dropped/replaced causing a use-after-free or panic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_internal_indexer_ledger_version()] [Version manipulation] Can get_persisted_version() return a manipulated version number that's ahead of the actual blockchain state, causing API responses to reference non-existent transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_internal_indexer_ledger_version()] [None vs Some confusion] Does returning Option<Version> properly distinguish between 'indexer at genesis' (Some(0)) vs 'indexer not initialized' (None), or can this be exploited to bypass version checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_table_info_ledger_version()] [next_version() semantics] Does next_version() at line 63 return the next version to be indexed or the latest indexed version, and can this ambiguity cause off-by-one errors in version range queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_table_info_ledger_version()] [Version race] Can next_version() be called concurrently with table info updates, returning an inconsistent version that breaks atomicity of version queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_latest_table_info_ledger_version()] [Wraparound attack] If next_version() is near u64::MAX, can integer wraparound cause it to return 0 or a small number, breaking all downstream version comparisons? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Functions: get_latest_internal_indexer_ledger_version() and get_latest_table_info_ledger_version()] [Version skew] Can the two indexers report vastly different versions (e.g., internal_indexer at v1000, table_info at v100), and how does the API handle queries where ledger_version falls between these values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Integer overflow] Can the start parameter at line 71 overflow when added to limit internally, causing the indexer to return events from unexpected sequence numbers or wrap around to low values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Limit bypass] Can an attacker pass u64::MAX as the limit parameter at line 73 to exhaust memory/CPU by forcing the indexer to load all events for an event_key? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer/src/indexer_reader.rs] [Function: get_events()] [Event key validation] Does get_events() validate that event_key is well-formed, or can crafted event keys with invalid addresses/counters cause panics or database corruption? (High)
